info.title: Orders API - PII data architecture
info.description:
VTEX stores using the [PII data architecture](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/pii-data-architecture-specifications) from [Data Protection Plus](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/data-protection-plus) must use this adapted version of the Orders API. Learn more about the modified behavior at [Changes in VTEX features behavior to handle PII data](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/changes-in-vtex-features-behavior-to-handle-pii-data).

>⚠️ The **Orders API - PII data architecture** is only compatible with stores using the PII data architecture from [Data Protection Plus](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/data-protection-plus), which is in closed beta phase, only available in selected regions.
>
> This feature is part of [VTEX Shield](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/vtex-shield--2CVk6H9eY2CBtHjtDI7BFh). If you are already a VTEX customer and want to adopt VTEX Shield for your business, please contact [Commercial Support](https://help.vtex.com/en/tracks/support-at-vtex--4AXsGdGHqExp9ZkiNq9eMy/3KQWGgkPOwbFTPfBxL7YwZ). Additional fees may apply. If you are not yet a customer but are interested in this solution, please complete our [contact form](https://vtex.com/us-en/contact/).

## Index

### Orders

- `GET` [Get order](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api-pii-version#get-/api/orders/pvt/document/-orderId-)
- `POST` [List orders](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api-pii-version#post-/api/orders/extendsearch/orders)
- `POST` [Start handling order](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api-pii-version#post-/api/orders/pvt/document/-orderId-/actions/start-handling)
- `POST` [Cancel order](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api-pii-version#post-/api/orders/pvt/document/-orderId-/cancel)

### Invoice

- `POST` [Order invoice notification](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api-pii-version#post-/api/orders/pvt/document/-orderId-/invoices)

### Payment

- `POST` [Send payment notification](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api-pii-version#post-/api/orders/pvt/document/-orderId-/payment/-paymentId-/notify-payment)

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account. Used as part of the URL.

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

get.description:
Retrieves order details by searching by order ID.

If you wish to retrieve unmasked data, use the `reason` query parameter.

>⚠️ Throttling: Each VTEX account can make up to 6000 requests per minute.

> You can only access information from orders created in the last two years, and that same period is valid for customers through [My Account](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-my-account-works--2BQ3GiqhqGJTXsWVuio3Xh).

> Check the [Orders onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/orders-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Orders and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| OMS | OMS access | **View order** |
| Checkout         | CheckoutResources | **Orders Full Access** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| OMS - Full access | View order |
| Checkout Admin | View order |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms | View order |
| OMS - Full access | Orders Full Access |
| Checkout Admin | Orders Full Access |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms | Orders Full Access |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or application keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using application keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

orderFormId.description: ID of the shopping cart from which the order was created.

productCategories.description: Object containing product categories with the structure: `{CategoryID}: {CategoryName}`.

additionalProperties.description: Product category corresponding to the ID in the field key.

ean.description: European Article Number (EAN) of the item.

seller.description: Seller name. When the store acts both as marketplace and seller, this field corresponds to `1`, because every VTEX store is its own seller 1.

priceValidUntil.description: Item price expiration date and time in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

productClusterId.description: All product clusters related to the item.

required.description: Defines if the attachment is required (`true`) or not (`false`).

schema.description: Schema of the content declared in the field `attachmentOfferings`.

assemblies.description: Information about the item customization, when applicable.

shippingPrice.description: Item shipping price in cents. This value does not account for the order total shipping price.

sellingPrice.description: Selling price in cents. This field can present rounding discrepancies, so we recommend retrieving pricing information from the `priceDefinition` field.

commission.description: Commission value registered for the seller.

priceTags.description: Information about price tags. A price tag is a price modifier, like s discount or a promotion applicable to the item in the order context.

items.description: Information about a given price tag.

isPercentual.description: Indicates whether price tag value is applied through a percentage (`true`) or not (`false`).

bundleItems.description: Information about services sold with the item. For example, a gift package.

offerings.description: Information about offerings, which are services related to the item. For example, a warranty or installation.

items.description: Name of the service related to the item. For example, warranty or installation.

preSaleDate.description: Presale date and time in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

isGift.description: Defines it the item is a gift (`true`) or not (`false`).

marketingData.description: Information about marketing and promotions, such as coupon code and [Urchin Tracking Module (UTM)](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/what-are-utm-source-utm-campaign-and-utm-medium--2wTz7QJ8KUG6skGAoAQuii).

utmSource.description: A UTM is an Urchin Tracking Module used to track traffic related to your store. This field is an UTM for tracking the traffic source, to know from which site, advertiser, or publication the customer came before reaching your site.

utmMedium.description: UTM for tracking the advertising or marketing media used to reach your site, such as banners and newsletters.

utmCampaign.description: UTM for tracking the marketing campaign context.

utmipage.description: A `utmi` is an internal Urchin Tracking Module (UTM) used to track traffic inside your site. This field is an internal UTM for tracking pages.

utmiPart.description: Internal UTM for tracking the partner.

utmiCampaign.description: Internal UTM for tracking the marketing campaign context.

coupon.description: Coupon code used by the customer.

marketingTags.description: List of marketing tags valid for the item.

parentAssemblyBinding.description: When items are indexed in between each other, this field returns the assembly option ID. This response is `null` for items that are not [assembly options](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/assembly-options--5x5FhNr4f5RUGDEGWzV1nH).

parentItemIndex.description: Ranking number that shows how related items are indexed in between each other. It starts at `0` as the primary item reference and counts up to `1`, `2`, and so on. For example, a customer bought sunglasses and hired a warranty service. Since the sunglasses are index `0`, the warranty service (the [assembly option](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/assembly-options--5x5FhNr4f5RUGDEGWzV1nH)) is index `1` and has the `parentItemIndex` value `0`. This response is `null` for items that are not assembly options.

callCenterOperator.description: Identification code of the call center operator that sold the item, when applicable.

calculatedSellingPrice.description: Item calculated selling price in cents.

value.description: Item selling price value in cents.

authorizedDate.description: Order authorization date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

subscriptionGroupId.description: Subscription group ID. If this field returns `null` and the `executionCount` is `0`, the order is the first subscription order.

executionCount.description: Position of the order in the subscription cycle. The first order will have the value `0`, the second will have the value `1`, and so on.

priceAtSubscriptionDate.description: Value of the order when the customer subscribed. Subscriptions created via VTEX Admin or [Subscriptions API](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/subscriptions-api-v3) do not have an original order, so this field returns `0.0`.

itemIndex.description: Each item in the subscription order is identified by an index. The position starts in `0`, followed by `1`, `2`, and so on.

interval.description: Time interval configured between subscription orders, which depends on the frequency. For a `DAY` frequency, the value will be days, for `MONTH` it will be months, and so on.

validity.description: Information about the period during which the subscription will be valid.

begin.description: Subscription plan beginning date and time in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

end.description: Subscription plan ending date and time in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

areTaxesDesignatedByMarketplace.description: Defines if the taxes were applied by the marketplace (`true`) or not (`false`).
Defines if the taxes were designated by the marketplace (`true`) or not (`false`).

sku.description: Alphanumeric sequence that identifies a SKU.

priceTags.description: Price tags information with the original taxes calculated at order placement.

items.description: Information about a given price tag.

isPercentual.description: Indicates whether price tag value is applied through a percentage (`true`) or not (`false`).

rawValue.description: Price tag raw value that can contain up to five decimals, separated by a period.

invoicedDate.description: Order invoice date and time in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

marketplaceServicesEndpoint.description: Marketplace endpoint for post purchase communication.

isCheckedIn.description: Defines if the order was placed via [VTEX Sales App](https://help.vtex.com/en/tracks/instore-getting-started-and-setting-up--zav76TFEZlAjnyBVL5tRc) (`true`) or not (`false`).

approvedBy.description: User who approved the order, in case of manual approval.

callCenterOperatorData.description: Information about the call center operator responsible for the order.

allowCancellation.description: Defines if order cancellation is allowed (`true`) or not anymore (`false`).

allowEdition.description: Defines if the order can be edited (`true`) or not anymore (`false`).

roundingError.description: Rounding error total amount in cents, when applicable. For example, in orders with a discount over non-integer multiplier items, the rounding price is performed per item, not after the sum of all items. That can cause a difference in the total discount amount, which is informed in this field.

salesChannel.description: Sales channel (or [trade policy](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/how-trade-policies-work--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV)) related to the order.

CurrencyDecimalSeparator.description: Defines what currency decimal separator will be applied.

CurrencyGroupSeparator.description: Defines what currency group separator will be applied.

CurrencyGroupSize.description: Defines how many characters will be grouped.

StartsWithCurrencySymbol.description: Defines if all prices will be initiated with the currency symbol (`true`) or not (`false`).

timeZone.description: Time zone where the order was created.

isActive.description: Defines if the sales channel is active (`true`) or inactive (`false`).

customData.description: Customizable fields created by the store for the shopping cart. This field is useful for storing data not included in other fields. For example, a message for a gift or a name to be printed in a shirt.

customApps.description: Customizable apps created by the store.

packageAttachment.description: Information about shipping packages, which are created after order invoicing.

courier.description: Name of the [carrier](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/carriers-on-vtex--7u9duMD5UQa2QQwukAWMcE) responsible for the package shipping.

invoiceNumber.description: Unique identification code of the package invoice.

issuanceDate.description: Package invoice issuance date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

embeddedInvoice.description: Package invoice text in [xml format](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/configuring-xml--tutorials_242). This field is important for stores integrated with [external marketplaces](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/external-marketplace-integration-guide).

type.description:
Package invoice type, which can be:
- `Output`: Selling order invoice.
- `Input`: Returning items invoice.

items.description: Information on each item in the package.

itemIndex.description: Item index of the item position whithin the `items` array. The count starts at `0`.

deliveredDate.description: Package delivery date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

status.description: Defines if a carrier was assigned for order shipping (`ok`) or not (`null`).

finished.description: Defines if the carrier has already delivered the package (`true`) or not (`false`).

lastChange.description: Date since package tracking last change in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

state.description: Package tracking state in two-digit code format.

createDate.description: Package tracking creation date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

cfop.description: [CFOP](https://www.gov.br/receitafederal/pt-br/acesso-a-informacao/acoes-e-programas/facilitacao/anexo-ecf-cfop) (_Código Fiscal de Operação e Prestação_) is a Brazilian fiscal code of operations and services that classifies business transaction types.

lastChange.description: Date since package tracking last change in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

restitutions.description: Information about a value being returned to the customer. This field applies only to invoices with the `Input` type because it relates to returning items.

items.description: Information about the items being returned.

useFreight.description: Defines if the refund includes freight values (`true`) or not (`false`).

isCompensation.description: Defines if there are compensated unit tags in the package (`true`) or not (`false`).

id.description: SKU ID of the returned item.

description.description: Customer reason for returning the item.

volumes.description: Indicates the number of boxes (volumes) needed to contain the package items. For example, two refrigerators do not fit in a single volume, so this field would have value `2`.

marketplace.description: Information about the marketplace related to the order.

isCertified.description: Defines if the marketplace is a [VTEX certified marketplace](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/marketplace-strategies-at-vtex--tutorials_402#integrating-with-certified-marketplaces) (`true`) or not (`false`).

loggedIn.description: Defines if the user was logged in the account or not (`true`) or not (`false`).

hasAccessToOrderFormEnabledByLicenseMana.description: Defines if in order placement the user had access to the order form enabled by the [License Manager](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) (`true`) or not (`false`).

lastMessage.description: Last transactional message sent to the customer.

workflowData.description: Information about order processing and workflow.

items.description: Order processing details for the marketplace and seller instances.

name.description: Workflow instance name, related to marketplace and fulfillment.

currentStepDescription.description: Current step description for the order status in the workflow.

lastChange.description: Date of the order last change in the workflow in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

isInError.description: Defines if the order processing in the workflow is in error (`true`) or not (`false`).

isInAutomaticRetry.description: Defines if the order is in automatic processing retry in the workflow (`true`) or not (`false`).

creationDate.description: Order creation date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

items.description: Information about a given workflow timeline step.

date.description: Timeline step processing date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

items.description: Information about a given logical workflow timeline step.

stepName.description: Name of the logical timeline step.

date.description: Logical timeline step processing date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

steps.description: Steps in the order processing in the workflow.

items.description: Details about a given step in the order processing.

next.description: Next order steps in the workflow.

items.description: Information about a given step in the workflow.

systemWillMove.description: Defines if the order can move to the next step (`true`) or not (`false`).

actionsAllowed.description: Type of actions allowed in the next steps.

type.description: Name of the order action allowed.

expectFlow.description: Defines if the order is progressing in the workflow as expected (`true`) or not (`false`).

systemWillMove.description: Defines if the order can move to the next workflow status (`true`) or not (`false`).

actionsAllowed.description: Type of actions allowed for order processing in the workflow.

type.description: Name of the order action allowed.

start.description: Defines if the step corresponds to the order creation (`true`) or not (`false`).

currentLogicalStep.description: Name of the order current logical step in the workflow.

checkedInPickupPointId.description: When the order is created at a physical store which is configured as a pickup point, this field retrieves the pickup point ID.

piiHidden.description: Defines if the VTEX account uses [PII data architecture](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/pii-data-architecture-specifications) (`true`) or not (`false`).

workflowIsInError.description: Indicates if the order workflow presents an error (`true`) or if there are no errors (`false`).

callCenterOperator.description: Identification code of the call center operator responsible for the order, when applicable.

timeZoneCreationDate.description: Order creation date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

timeZoneLastChange.description: Date of the order processing last change in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

locale.description: Language code of the customer preferred language while accessing the store.

optinNewsLetter.description: Defines if the customer receives the store's newsletter (`true`) or not (`false`).

creationDate.description: Order creation date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

id.description: Total ID, which defines what the total is about.

alternativeTotals.description: Information about the order alternative totals, when applicable. For example, when there is a discount for items in the marketplace that results in a difference in the `Items` total value, the `alternativeTotals` can retrieve details about it.

items.description: Details about the order alternative totals.

id.description: Alternative total ID, which can be related to items, discounts, shipping or taxes.

sequence.description: Sequence number part of the order ID. For example, in order `v70530116str-01`, the sequence is `70530116`.

items.description: Receipt with information about a given transaction.

date.description: Receipt transaction date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

isCompleted.description: Defines if the order payment has been settled (`true`) or not (`false`).

affiliateId.description: Three-letter [affiliate](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/configuring-affiliates--tutorials_187) code configured by the seller to identify a marketplace.

followUpEmail.description: Email of the store employee responsible for managing the order.

lastChange.description: Order last change date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

sellers.description: Information about the sellers associated with the order.

fulfillmentEndpoint.description: URL of the endpoint for fulfillment of seller's orders, which the marketplace use to communicate with the seller.

subSellerId.description: Sub seller ID. When the main account acts both as seller and marketplace, this field will return the value `1`.

marketingData.description: Information about marketing and promotions, such as coupon code and [Urchin Tracking Module (UTM)](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/what-are-utm-source-utm-campaign-and-utm-medium--2wTz7QJ8KUG6skGAoAQuii).

utmSource.description: A UTM is an Urchin Tracking Module used to track traffic related to your store. This field is an UTM for tracking the traffic source, to know from which site, advertiser, or publication the customer came before reaching your site.

utmMedium.description: UTM for tracking the advertising or marketing media used to reach your site, such as banners and newsletters.

utmCampaign.description: UTM for tracking the marketing campaign context.

utmipage.description: A `utmi` is an internal Urchin Tracking Module (UTM) used to track traffic inside your site. This field is an internal UTM for tracking pages.

utmiPart.description: Internal UTM for tracking the partner.

utmiCampaign.description: Internal UTM for tracking the marketing campaign context.

coupon.description: Coupon code used by the customer.

marketingTags.description: List of marketing tags valid for the order.

ratesAndBenefitsData.description: Information about promotions and taxes valid for the order.

items.description: Information about a given promotion or tax.

featured.description: Defines if the [target audience](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/creating-a-campaign-audience--6cnuDZJzIkIeocewAQQK4K) is featured (`true`) or not (`false`).

matchedParameters.description: Conditions met by the purchase for the promotion or tax to be applied.

additionalInfo.description: Object containing additional information about the promotion or tax.

redemptionCode.description: Gift card code used by the customer at checkout.

caption.description: Gift card loyalty program, when applicable.

balance.description: Gift card current balance. For newly created gift cards, the balance will be `0.0`.

inUse.description: Defines if the gift card is in use (`true`) or not (`false`).

isSpecialCard.description: Defines if the gift card is a special card (`true`) or not (`false`).

transactions.description: Information about the order financial transactions.

isActive.description: Defines of the transaction is active (`true`) or inactive (`false`).

bankIssuedInvoiceIdentificationNumberFor.description: Bank issued invoice numeric sequence formatted as customers see.

parentAccountId.description: When the payment was made in a subaccount, this field retrieves the main account ID.

accountId.description: Identification code of the account where the payment was made.

group.description: Transaction payment method, which can be credit card, debid card, bank invoice, promissory, gift card or pix (`instantPayment`).

isGiftCardDiscount.description: Defines if the payment has a gift card discount (`true`) or not (`false`).

redemptionCode.description: Gift card code used by the customer at checkout.

tid.description: Provider unique identifier for the transaction.

cvv2.description: Card Verification Value (CVV2) is a security code used by payment processors to reduce fraudulent credit and debit card transactions.

referenceValue.description: Total payment reference value in cents.

connectorResponses.description: Payment provider (connector) responses. The fields within this object can vary according to the order payment provider.

Message.description: Provider operational message or error to be logged.

tid.description: Provider unique identifier for the transaction.

delayToAutoSettle.description: Total time (in seconds) before the auto settle, when the platform makes an automatic call to `/settlements`, regardless if the payment was approved by the merchant's anti-fraud provider. The maximum value allowed is `604800` seconds (7 days).

ReturnCode.description: Provider operational return code or error to be logged.

nsu.description: Provider unique sequential number for the transaction.

code.description: Provider operational code or error to be logged.

message.description: Provider operational message or error to be logged.

Tid.description: Provider unique identifier for the transaction.

delayToAutoSettleAfterAntifraud.description: Total time (in seconds) before the auto settle, when the platform makes an automatic call to `/settlements`. This happens only after the payment was approved by the merchant's anti-fraud provider.

value.description: Order total payment value in cents.

paymentOrigin.description: Type of [wallet](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/what-is-an-e-wallet--4v5wcOe4A0SiaimWM2cU60) used in the payment.

bankIssuedInvoiceBarCodeNumber.description: Bank issued invoice bar code number.

bankIssuedInvoiceBarCodeType.description: Bank issued invoice bar code type.

addressType.description: Billing address type, which can be `residential`, when the customer gives an address for delivery, or `pickup`, when the customer picks the order at a pickup point.

receiverName.description: Full name of the order receiver.

country.description: Billing address three-digit country code in [ISO 3166 ALPHA-3](https://www.iban.com/country-codes) format.

geoCoordinates.description: Billing address pair of geolocation coordinates, first longitude then latitude.

sharedTransaction.description: Defines if the transaction is shared (`true`) or not (`false`).

addressType.description: Invoice address type, which can be `residential`, when the customer gives an address for delivery, or `pickup`, when the customer picks the order at a pickup point.

receiverName.description: Full name of the order receiver.

country.description: Invoice address three-digit country code in [ISO 3166 ALPHA-3](https://www.iban.com/country-codes) format.

geoCoordinates.description: Invoice address pair of geolocation coordinates, first longitude then latitude.

paymentMethods.description: List of the payment methods used by the customer in the purchase.

settleInvoices.description: List with the order settled invoices.

CurrencyGroupSize.description: Limit of characters that can be grouped for currency groups.

StartsWithCurrencySymbol.description: Defines if the prices displayed for customers start with the currency symbol (`true`) or not (`false`).

timeZone.description: Time zone considered for the store orders.

items.description: Metadata details about a given item

name.description: Item name as displayed to customers in the storefront.

ean.description: European Article Number (EAN) of the item.

assemblyOptions.description: [Assembly options](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/assembly-options--5x5FhNr4f5RUGDEGWzV1nH) information related to the item, when applicable.

required.description: Defines if sending the attachment for the item purchased is required(`true`) or optional (`false`).

creationEnvironment.description: Order creation environment, which can be a [development workspace](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/vtex-io-documentation-creating-a-development-workspace) (`BETA`) or a [production workspace](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/vtex-io-documentation-creating-a-production-workspace) (`STABLE`).

requestedByUser.description: Defines if the order cancellation was requested by the customer (`true`) or not (`false`).

requestedBySystem.description: Defines if the order cancellation was made by the system (`true`) or not (`false`). This type of order cancellation happens in [incomplete orders](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-incomplete-orders-work--tutorials_294), for example.

requestedBySellerNotification.description: Defines if the order cancellation was requested by the seller (`true`) or not (`false`).

requestedByPaymentNotification.description: Defines if the order cancellation was requested by the payment gateway (`true`) or not (`false`).

reason.description: Reason why the order was canceled.

cancellationDate.description: Order cancellation date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

cancellationRequestId.description: ID that identifies the cancellation operation.

cancellationRequests.description: Information about the [seller order cancellation denials](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/order-canceling-improvements), regardless if the cancellation request was made by the marketplace or the customer.

items.description: Information about the seller denial to a given order cancellation request.

id.description: ID that identifies the original cancellation operation made by the marketplaces or its customer care service using the [Cancel order](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api#post-/api/oms/pvt/orders/-orderId-/cancel) endpoint.

reason.description: Reason why there was a request to cancel the order.

cancellationRequestDate.description: Date of when the order cancellation request was processed by the platform. The date format is [ISO 8601 time zone offset](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

requestedByUser.description: Defines if the order cancellation was requested by the customer (`true`) or not (`false`).

deniedBySeller.description: Defines if the order cancellation request was [denied by the seller](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/order-canceling-improvements) (`true`) or accepted by the seller (`false`).

deniedBySellerReason.description: Reason given by the seller for denying the order cancellation.

cancellationRequestDenyDate.description: Date of when the platform processed the seller denial to an order cancellation request. The date format is [ISO 8601 time zone offset](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

address.street: Avenue Pastor Martin Luther King Jr.

post.description:
Retrieves a list of orders according to the query parameters used. The response returns masked order data.

>⚠️ Throttling: Each account can make up to 6000 requests per minute.

## Endpoint not meant for integrations
This request only retrieves orders that have been indexed, which takes aproximately four minutes. The information returned also may present inconsistencies or become unavailable in periods of peak order volume.

Therefore, you must not use the List orders endpoint for integrations.

>⚠️ To get up to date information and [build order integrations](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/erp-integration-set-up-order-integration) use the [orders Feed or Hook](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/feed-v3-1).

> Check the [Orders onboarding guide](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/orders-overview). We created this guide to improve the onboarding experience for developers at VTEX. It assembles all documentation on our Developer Portal about Orders and is organized by focusing on the developer's journey.

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| OMS | OMS access | **List Orders** |
| Checkout         | CheckoutResources | **Orders Full Access** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| OMS - Full access | List Orders |
| Checkout Admin | List Orders |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms | List Orders |
| OMS - Full access | Orders Full Access |
| Checkout Admin | Orders Full Access |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms | Orders Full Access |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or application keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using application keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

f_status.description:
Filters orders by [order status](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/order-flow-and-status--tutorials_196). The possible values are:
- `waiting-for-sellers-confirmation`
- `payment-pending`
- `payment-approved`
- `ready-for-handling`
- `handling`
- `invoiced`
- `canceled`

f_creationDate.description:
Filters orders by creation date by concatenating the `creationDate` prefix with the desired date range in [ISO 8601 format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `creationDate:[YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ TO YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ]`. For example:
- 1 day: `creationDate:[2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z TO 2024-01-02T00:00:00.000Z]`
- 1 month: `creationDate:[2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z TO 2024-02-01T00:00:00.000Z]`
- 1 year: `creationDate:[2023-01-01T00:00:00.000Z TO 2024-01-01T00:00:00.000Z]`

incompleteOrders.description: Filters orders by showing only [incomplete orders](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/understanding-incomplete-orders) (`true`), or only complete orders (`false`).

filterError.description: Filters orders by error in the workflow processing. You can choose to filter by temporary error (`temp`), permanet error (`perm`) or include all errors (`all`).

per_page.description: Number of orders per page, up to the limit of 100 results.

page.description: Number of the page to be retrieved.

orderBy.description:
Filters and sorts orders by combining an **OrderField** with a **SortType** value. To do so, you have to concatenate them, as in `OrderField,SortType`. The values accepted are the following:
- **OrderField:** `creationDate`, `orderId`, `totalValue` and `origin`.
- **SortType:** `asc` and `desc`.

See below some examples of the `orderBy` field with different `OrderField` values for the `SortType` value `asc`:
- **orderBy creation date:** `creationDate,asc`
- **orderBy order ID:** `orderId,asc`
- **orderBy total value:** `totalValue,asc`
- **orderBy origin:** `origin,asc`

q.description:
Full-text search for the orders considering the following fields:
- `orderId`
- `clientEmail`
- `clientDocument`
- `clientName`

sku_Ids.description: Filters orders by SKU ID. To use multiple SKU IDs, separate them using a comma.

listId.description: Filters orders by gift list ID.

f_authorizedDate.description: Filters orders by authorized date by concatenating the sufix `authorizedDate` with the desired date range in [ISO 8601 format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `authorizedDate:[YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ TO YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ]`.

pci_tid.description: Filters orders by the PCI provider transaction ID.

nsu.description: Filters orders by the provider unique sequential number for the transaction.

f_hasInputInvoice.description: Filters orders with the `invoicesInput` field value different from `null` when set to `true`.

f_hasOutputInvoice.description: Filters only orders with the `invoicesOutput` field value different from `null`  when set to `true`.

f_invoicedDate.description: Filters orders by invoice date by concatenating the `invoicedDate` prefix with the desired date range in [ISO 8601 format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `invoicedDate:[YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ TO YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ]`.

f_shippingEstimate.description:
Filters orders by shipping estimate time in days by concatenating the desired number of days with the `.days` suffix. For example:
- Next 7 days: `7.days`
- Tomorrow: `1.days`
- Today: `0.days`
- Late: `-1.days`

f_callCenterOperatorName.description: Filters orders by call center operator name.

f_isInstore.description: Filters orders made via [VTEX Sales App](https://help.vtex.com/en/tracks/instore-getting-started-and-setting-up--zav76TFEZlAjnyBVL5tRc/7fnnVlG3Kv1Tay9iagc5yf) (`true`) or not made via VTEX Sales App (`false`).

f_RnB.description: Filters orders by promotion or tax name.

salesChannelId.description: Filters orders by sales channel ([or trade policy](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-trade-policies-work--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV)) ID.

f_salesChannel.description: Filters orders by sales channel ([or trade policy](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-trade-policies-work--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV)) name.

sequence.description: Sequence number part of the order ID. For example, in order `v71041992str-01`, the sequence is `71041992`.

clientCorporateDocument.description: Corporate document, if the customer is a legal entity.

clientCorporateName.description: Corporate name, if the customer is a legal entity.

sellerNames.description: Names of the sellers responsible for order fuflillment.

sellerIds.description: IDs of the sellers responsible for order fuflillment.

pciTransactionId.description: List with the PCI transaction ID.

paymentNSU.description: Unique sequence number that identifies a sales transaction using cards.

ratesAndBenefitsNames.description: List of the promotions and taxes names valid for the purchase.

ratesAndBenefitsIds.description: List of the promotions and taxes IDs valid for the purchase.

shippingEstimatedDateMax.description: Maximum shipping estimated date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

shippingEstimatedDateMin.description: Minimum shipping estimated date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

transactionIds.description: Array with payment transaction IDs information.

isInstore.description: Defines if the order was placed via [VTEX Sales App](https://help.vtex.com/en/tracks/instore-getting-started-and-setting-up--zav76TFEZlAjnyBVL5tRc) (`true`) or not (`false`).

deliveryChannel.description: List of delivery channels, which can be delivery or [pickup point](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/pickup-points--2fljn6wLjn8M4lJHA6HP3R).

productIds.description: List of product IDs related to the orders items.

creationDate.description: Order creation date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

invoicedDate.description: Order invoice date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

authorizedDate.description: Order authorization date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

orderIsComplete.description: Defines if the order is complete (`true`) or [incomplete](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-incomplete-orders-work--tutorials_294) (`false`).

marketingTags.description: List of marketing tags valid for the order.

invoicesOutput.description: Information about order invoice `Output` operation, when the store sells an item to the customer.

invoicesInput.description: Information about order invoice `Input` operation, when the customer returnes an item to the store.

workflowInErrorState.description: Defines if the order processing in the workflow is in error (`true`) or not (`false`).

workflowInRetry.description: Defines if the order is in automatic processing retry in the workflow (`true`) or not (`false`).

lastChange.description: Order last change date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

isAllDelivered.description: Defines if all order items have being delivered (`true`) or not (`false`).

isAnyDelivered.description: Defines if any order item has being delivered (`true`) or not (`false`).

orderFormId.description: ID of the shopping cart from which the order was created.

paymentApprovedDate.description: Payment approval date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

readyForHandlingDate.description: Order ready for handling date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

items.description: Order delivey date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

callCenterOperatorEmail.description: Email of the call center operator responsible for the order, when applicable.

callCenterOperatorName.description: Name of the call center operator responsible for the order, when applicable.

productNames.description: List of the order product names.

total.description: Total number of objects that exist for the `list` field, each corresponding to an order.

perPage.description: Number of objects per page that can be returned for the `list` field. The default value is `15` and the maximum value is `100`.

post.description:
Changes the [order status](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/order-flow-and-status--tutorials_196) in the workflow to the `handling` status.

>ℹ️ Successful requests receive a `204` status code with no content.

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| OMS | OMS access | **Change order workflow status** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| OMS - Full access | Change order workflow status |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Gateway Oms | Change order workflow status |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms | Change order workflow status |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or application keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using application keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

Requests order cancelation by searching by order ID.

It is possible for the seller to [decline an order cancelation request](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/declining-order-cancelation--F2n0h1TeQ5td540Gjyff4), know more in [Order canceling improvements](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/order-canceling-improvements).

>⚠️ You can only cancel an order in the `invoiced` [status](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/order-flow-and-status--tutorials_196) if you send a return invoice first, using the [Order invoice notification](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/orders-api-pii-version#post-/api/orders/pvt/document/-orderId-/invoices) endpoint. 

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| OMS | OMS access | **Cancel order** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| OMS - Full access | Cancel order |
| Sales App - Sales Associate | Cancel order |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Gateway | Cancel order |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Gateway Oms | Cancel order |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms | Cancel order |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or application keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using application keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

date.description: Cancellation request date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

orderId.description: Order ID in the seller environment.

receipt.description: Protocol code generated by the cancellation request.

403.description: The credentials are not enabled to access the service.

post.description:
Endpoint used by the seller after order invoicing to send the invoice information to the marketplace.

Once the seller has the order tracking information, it is also possible to use this endpoint to send order tracking information to the marketplace.

>⚠️ To avoid price rounding errors, we strongly recommend sending the object with the invoiced items in the request body.

>❗ It is not allowed to use the same `invoiceNumber` in more than one request. 

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| OMS | OMS access | **Notify invoice** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| OMS - Full access | Notify invoice |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Gateway Oms | Notify invoice |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms | Notify invoice |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or application keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using application keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

type.description:
Invoice type, which can be:
- `Output`: Selling invoice type, used for the customer to receive the product.
- `Input`: Returning invoice type, used for the customer to return a product to the store.

issuedDate.description: Invoice issuance date in the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

invoiceNumber.description: Unique number that identifies the invoice.

invoiceValue.description: Total price being invoiced in cents. Do not use any decimal separator. For instance, `$24.99` should be represented as `2499`.

extraValue.description: Extra value in the invoice in cents. Do not use any decimal separator. For instance, `$24.99` should be represented as `2499`.

invoiceUrl.description: Invoice URL. It can be used to send the URL of an XML file, for example, which is useful for some integrations.

courier.description:
The name of the carrier responsible for delivering the order.
> This field should only be used when sending **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).

trackingNumber.description:
Code that identifies the order tracking.
> This field should only be used when sending the **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).

trackingUrl.description:
URL used to track the order.
> This field should only be used when sending the **tracking** information. When the request is used for sending the invoice, this field should be left empty (`""`).

items.description: Array containing the SKUs that are being invoiced.
Information about an item being invoiced.

itemIndex.description: Index of the SKU being invoiced. The position starts in `0`, followed by `1`, `2`, and so on.

price.description: Total price of the SKU being invoiced in cents. Do not use any decimal separator. For instance, `$24.99` should be represented as `2499`.

quantity.description: Quantity of the SKU being invoiced.

cfop.description: [CFOP](https://www.gov.br/receitafederal/pt-br/acesso-a-informacao/acoes-e-programas/facilitacao/anexo-ecf-cfop) (_Código Fiscal de Operação e Prestação_) is a Brazilian fiscal code of operations and services that classifies business transactions types.

volumes.description: Number of volumes in the invoice.

date.description: Date and time when the order invoice notification was received in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

orderId.description: Order ID in the seller environment.

receipt.description: Protocol code generated by the request.

post.description:
Sends the payment notification of an order by searching by order ID and payment ID.

> For more information about transaction details, check the article [Viewing the order's details in Orders](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/viewing-the-orders-details-in-orders--tutorials_452).

## Permissions

Any user or [API key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/api-authentication-using-api-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint:

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| --------------- | ----------------- | ----------------- |
| OMS | OMS access | **Notify payment** |

You can [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) with that resource or use one of the following [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy):

| **Role** | **Resource** | 
| --------------- | ----------------- | 
| OMS - Full access | Notify payment |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Gateway | Notify payment |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Gateway Oms | Notify payment |
| IntegrationProfile - Fulfillment Oms | Notify payment |

>❗ Assigning a [predefined role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) to users or application keys usually grants permission to multiple [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3). If some of these permissions are not necessary, consider creating a custom role instead. For more information regarding security, see [Best practices for using application keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-api-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm). To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication).

ClientProfileData.description: Information about the client who created the order.

corporateDocument.description: If the client is a legal entity, this field includes the corporate document.

corporateName.description: If the client is a legal entity, this field includes the corporate name.

tradeName.description: If the client is a legal entity, this field includes the trade name.

stateInscription.description: If the client is a legal entity, this field includes the corporate state inscription.

corporatePhone.description: If the client is a legal entity, this field includes the corporate telephone number.

isCorporate.description: Defines if the client is corporate and a legal entity (`true`) or not (`false`).

polygonName.description: Name of the [polygon](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/registering-geolocation/) associated with the [shipping policy](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/shipping-policy--tutorials_140).

shippingEstimate.description: Shipping estimate time in days. For instance, three business days is represented `3bd`.

price.description: Item shipping price in cents. This value does not correspond to the order total shipping price.

deliveryChannel.description: Defines if the delivery channel is delivery or pickup.

shippingEstimateDate.description: Shipping estimate date, defined after order confirmation, in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

deliveryChannels.description: Delivery channels associated with the sales channel (or [trade policy](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/how-trade-policies-work--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV)).

items.description: Shipping address three-digit country code in [ISO 3166 ALPHA-3](https://www.iban.com/country-codes) format.

listPrice.description: SLA shipping list price in cents.

price.description: SLA shipping price in cents. Does not account for the order total shipping price.

availableDeliveryWindows.description: Available delivery windows information, when applicable.

items.description: Information about an available delivery window.

lockTTL.description: Logistics [reservation](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-does-reservation-work--tutorials_92) waiting time related to the SLA.

shippingEstimateDate.description: SLA shipping estimate date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

shippingEstimate.description: Shipping estimate time in days. For instance, three business days is represented `3bd`.

deliveryChannel.description: Defines if the delivery channel is delivery or [pickup point](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/pickup-points--2fljn6wLjn8M4lJHA6HP3R).

id.description: ID of the shipping method used in the [shipping policy](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/shipping-policy--tutorials_140).

pickupDistance.description: Distance in kilometers between the pickup point and the customer address. The distance is measured as a straight line.

polygonName.description: Name of the [polygon](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/registering-geolocation/) associated with the shipping policy.

transitTime.description: Number of days the carrier takes in transit to deliver the order. For instance, three business days is represented `3bd`.

selectedDeliveryChannel.description: Delivery channel selected by the customer. This field is being deprecated and the information it retrieves can be found in the `deliveryChannel` field.

selectedSla.description: Service Level Agreement (SLA), which corresponds to the shipping method selected by the customer, usually like normal or express.

itemIndex.description: Each item in the order is identified by an index. The position starts in `0`, followed by `1`, `2`, and so on.

transitTime.description: Number of days the carrier takes in transit to deliver the order. For instance, three business days is represented `3bd`.

receiverName.description: Full name of the order receiver.

country.description: Selected address three-digit country code in [ISO 3166 ALPHA-3](https://www.iban.com/country-codes) format.

geoCoordinates.description: Selected address pair of geolocation coordinates, first longitude then latitude.

receiverName.description: Full name of the order receiver.

country.description: Available address three-digit country code in [ISO 3166 ALPHA-3](https://www.iban.com/country-codes) format.

geoCoordinates.description: Available address pair of geolocation coordinates, first longitude then latitude.

receiverName.description: Full name of the order receiver.

country.description: Shipping address three-digit country code in [ISO 3166 ALPHA-3](https://www.iban.com/country-codes) format.

geoCoordinates.description: Shipping address pair of geolocation coordinates, first longitude then latitude.

PickupStoreInfo.description: Information about a [loading dock](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/loading-dock--5DY8xHEjOLYDVL41Urd5qj) that was transformed into a [pickup point](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/pickup-points--2fljn6wLjn8M4lJHA6HP3R).

isPickupStore.description: Defines if the shipping type was pickup (`true`) or not (`false`).

friendlyName.description: Name of the pickup point displayed at checkout.

country.description: Three-digit country code of the pickup point address in [ISO 3166 ALPHA-3](https://www.iban.com/country-codes) format.

dockId.description: ID of the loading dock related to the pickup point.

ChangesAttachment.description: Information about changes in the order.

reason.description: Text explaining why the order was changed. This information may be shown to the customer in the storefront or transactional emails.

discountValue.description: Order change discount value in cents.

incrementValue.description: Order change increment value in cents.

itemsAdded.description: Information about items added to the order, when applicable.

items.description: Information about an item added to the order.

itemsRemoved.description: Information about items removed from the order, when applicable.

items.description: Information about an item removed from the order.

date.description: Receipt creation date in [ISO 8601 time zone offset format](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/storageservices/formatting-datetime-values), as in `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

SumOfSquares.description: Sum of squares related to fulfillment.

Max.description: Maximum value related to the marketplace.

Mean.description: Value mean related to the marketplace.

Min.description: Minimum value related to the marketplace.

Missing.description: Missing values related to the marketplace.

StdDev.description: Standard deviation related to the marketplace.

Sum.description: Values sum related to the marketplace.

SumOfSquares.description: Sum of squares related to the marketplace.

currencyCode.description: Total value currency code in [ISO 4217](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes) format.

Count.description: Value count related to the currency code.

Max.description: Maximum value related to the currency code.

Mean.description: Value mean related to the currency code.

Min.description: Minimum value related to the currency code.

Missing.description: Missing values related to the currency code.

StdDev.description: Standard deviation related to the currency code.

Sum.description: Sum of values related to the currency code.

SumOfSquares.description: Sum of squares related to the currency code.

Facets.description: Facets related to the currency code.

Fulfillment.description: Seller (fulfillment) facets information related to total items.

Max.description: Maximum of items related to fulfillment.

Min.description: Minimum of items related to fulfillment.

Sum.description: Sum of items related to fulfillment.

SumOfSquares.description: Items sum of squares related to fulfillment.

Marketplace.description: Marketplace facets information related to total items.

Count.description: Items count related to the marketplace.

Max.description: Maximum of items related to the marketplace.

Mean.description: Items mean related to the marketplace.

Min.description: Minimum of items related to the marketplace.

Missing.description: Missing items related to the marketplace.

StdDev.description: Standard deviation related to the marketplace.

Sum.description: Sum of items related to the marketplace.

SumOfSquares.description: Sum of squares related to the marketplace.

currencyCode.description: Total items currency code in [ISO 4217](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes) format.

Count.description: Items count related to the currency code.

Max.description: Maximum of items related to the currency code.

Mean.description: Items mean related to the currency code.

Min.description: Minimum of items related to the currency code.

Missing.description: Missing items related to the currency code.

StdDev.description: Standard deviation related to the currency code.

Sum.description: Sum of items related to the currency code.

SumOfSquares.description: Sum of squares related to the currency code.

Facets.description: Facets related to the currency code.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: Type of the content being sent.

Accept.name: Accept
Accept.description: HTTP Client Negotiation _Accept_ Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.
